Why would anyone pirate an online game? Simple. Loads of games are sold that simply do not work. This way you know before you waste your money.

And if your system is somewhat weak and you are unsure you will enjoy the game you can try it out and see how it performs.

Any1 getting the 'failed to delete..' or patching failed etc non-starts (mine is XP SP3): when prompted which OSuser account to run the game with, you have to select the admin account (ie the bottom part of the dialog), and it has to have a password of some sort; it's not the crack - legit users seem to be getting it as well, and its a pain in the arse (well it will be if i have to input a pwd all the time)
Anyway, I've been playing SP for a little while - and it seems it will be a fairly challenging mix of maintaining turret defenses, upgrading skills and frantic botblasting, as the rounds progress. There's a selection of classes and they all seem effective if used correctly, although you can die pretty quickly when it gets hot (i think the support classes will need to rely on building turrets in SP) Of course, the general rule for pirated games is no multiplayer unless otherwise stated, but MP is probably possible using VPN or whatever - try google, however if you like what you see & you're MP inclined, you'll probably get your money's worth if you buy it
